page.title: 10SELBY GOLF CLUB
page.content:
There are about 700 members of Selby Golf Club: 500 men, 90 ladies, 60 juniors - the rest are social members. Membership is Â£122 per year for a man - ladies and juniors pay less. The course is 6084 yards long and the grounds cover 99 acres (with further plans to extend this to 120 acres). Dances and other social events are held in the Club House. There are 9 people who help run the Club and there is 1 professional golfer, David Jagger. Tournaments and matches are held throught the Summer against local teams.
Male members are divided into 'tigers' and 'rabbits'. 'Rabbits' have a handicap of l6-28, 'tigers' have a handicap of 0-16. New players usually start with a handicap of 28; the aim then being to reduce this to below 10.
